p: Terpenoids isolated from medicinal plants have attracted attention because many of them exhibit specific in vitro antiviral effect against SARS-CoV (Wen et al. 2007). Triterpenoids inhibit the entry of Ebola, Marburg, HIV, and influenza A viruses with distinct structure-activity relationships (Si et al. 2018). These natural agents modulate a broad range of virus-host fusion functions via wrapping the heptad repeat 2 domain prevalent in viral envelopes. Euphorbia neriifolia L. produces 22 triterpenoids with stronger activity against HCoVs than actinomycin D (Chang et al. 2012).
